intro: Comesperma mansonii, commonly known as the mountain hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
